TopicTitle: Can I not take data OUT of a mobile processing lab?

Articles.Content:
I have a small MPL-equipped station in orbit around Minimus, and brought some delicious science data up in there. Decided I didn't like the massive transmission losses and would rather remove the data and place it in a return capsule instead. But... that's not an option?

Edited September 14, 2014 by qeveren
You should be able to remove the data while on EVA. The only issue will be that command pods can only store one copy of each experiment per biome whereas the MPL can store unlimited copies.
Huh, okay, I see what was happening. The data was actually in a capsule docked with the lab; apparently it can process data stored in any connected part. Mischief managed, I guess?
